\

How can we be instruments for positive change\, without being overwhelmed by the emotions that can arise in a heart wanting to make a difference?

\

column2: Dialog med Professor David Cadman från London\

David Cadman är ekonom och författare. Han har varit adj. professor på många universitet i England\, bland annat på University of Reading och University College London. Vid Wolfson College\, Cambridge\, arbetade han med det man i England kallar ”Land Economy”\, som är en studie i juridik\, ekonomi och miljö.

\

Som född kväkare är han van att föra dialoger. Han är en mycket varm och humoristisk person med en stor portion nyfikenhet. David vill inte kalla sig för en akademiker\, utan bara någon som har ställt många frågor! Han kommer till Stockholm för att tala om kärlek och ekonomi\, något som han tror kommer att väcka känslor.

\

It might be somewhat controversial or uncomfortable to put together ”Economy” and ”Love”. Many might quite reasonably assume that there is a separate place for economy and a separate place for love\, one perhaps public and the other private. It might seem unusual to suggest that the two are intimately interconnected. And yet this must be so\, since love is the foundation of our well-being.

\

An Economy of Love is based upon abundance\, co-operation and the well-being of the whole while our old economic system is based upon scarcity\, corruption and fear. The principal of love is not that we all have the same\, but that everyone has enough - food\, water\, shelter\, health\, education and community. We have been brought up in an economy of fearfulness where competition and individual satisfaction rules. This model tries to persuade us that it is only by each one of us maximising our own satisfactions that the good of all can be ensured. The economy can only flourish by having more and more because it is economic growth that is the aim. The evident problem is that growth cannot continue forever. So\, is there another way?

\

What would an Economy of Love look like?
\

•    What would be the relationships between consumers\, retailers and producers?
\

•    What would be the relationships between workers\, managers and shareholders?
\

•    How would business measure their success to include social\, environmental and economic well-being?
\

•    How would personal values of love and compassion be carried through to the public realm of economy?

\

David Cadman uppfattar att ett paradigmskifte börjar ta form och bjuder in till en intressant dialog i ämnet över äkta engelskt eftermiddagste och kaka!
\

How to strengthen your natural resistance to dis-ease!

\

We know our body has a buit in 'immune system' designed to protect and maintain our physical health.  Yet we also know that most of our physical ailments have their origins in the mind in what we call the 'psychosomatic factor'.  But it seems few of us are aware that the origin of almost all our physical and mental/emotional ailments such as anxiety\, depression and frustration have their origins in the soul.  It's also where we find our natural immunity to all forms of dis-ease.  But we need to consciously re-activate it\, empower it and allow it to do its work for us.  

\

In this talk Mike will explore:

In the past three decades the pace of life has accelerated dramatically. Stress has not only become a major topic of discussion but\, sadly\, an accepted part of life. And while we continue to push ourselves to do more and more\, faster and faster\, this hectic living is silently – or maybe not so silently - taking its toll on our health and relationships. Our aim for the  ‘IMAGINE’ event is to generate such an atmosphere of calm and powerful awareness that everyone leaves knowing how a more centred\, harmonious way of living can be both possible and practical in these demanding times.

In addition to insights from Sister Jayanti\, ‘IMAGINE’ will include live performances from the Ordsall Acapella Singers.

Voyage initiatique à la rencontre de ses maîtres
\

Les vendredis 1 et 08 février\, de 19h30 à 21h (à la carte)
\

Le hasard n’existe pas dit-on. Alors cheminons ensemble\, ouverts\, curieux\, et laissons la magie opérer en invoquant le vieil adage : « Quand l’élève est prêt\, le maître arrive. »
\

Au-dessus des nuages brille toujours le soleil. Pour garder la fraîcheur et l’ouverture de l’esprit dans l’aventure\, le voyageur gardera dans son sac à dos cette réflexion d’Einstein :
\

« Si nous ne changeons pas notre façon de penser\, nous ne serons pas capables de résoudre les problèmes que nous créons avec nos modes actuels de pensée ».
\

The most important journey you can take is the journey within. This is a journey to the truth of who you really are.

\

Learn Raja Yoga\, a practical and simple form of meditation and spiritual understanding that sets the foundation for ongoing spiritual development. It is about discovering\, exploring and understanding one’s inner world of thoughts\, feelings\, attitudes\, values\, and intentions and developing the spiritual skills / inner strength to face the realities of the outer world. It is the art of bringing inner and outer realities into balance starting from the inside out. Becoming more aware of your internal environment enables you to check\, choose and change. You will start
\

to develop a sense of mastery as you recognize the inner resources that you have and your ability and responsibility to use them to create a better quality of life.

\

You will learn to see the self as a soul … a spiritual being and experience a direct connection and relationship with the Supreme Source of purest energy and highest consciousness. Every soul has a right to experience this ultimate relationship.

\

Facilitators: Sandra Budge\, Champa Patel\, Vijay Ramdhan
